title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.45 | 16-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: This indicates that Bhismadeva is a very, very great personality not only recognized as a great personality on this earth planet but also in the upper planets even by the devatas
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and highlights Bhismadeva's greatness, recognized both on Earth and in the higher planets.

segments.key_quote: Although he was a human being, as Bhishma he was a human being. But his position was on the level of Brahma.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Bhismadeva's position as a Mahajana, comparing him to Brahma, Narada, and Shiva, emphasizing his spiritual perfection.

segments.key_quote: qualification on a par with the great demigods is possible only an attainment of spiritual perfection not by material qualifications
segments.summary: The lecture discusses how spiritual perfection allows for interplanetary travel, contrasting it with modern mechanical methods, and describes the universal respect shown at Bhismadeva's passing.

segments.key_quote: the body of a pure devotee is never material even if there is some material light that is not material
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the showering of flowers is a sign of recognition by demigods and not a mere decoration of a dead body, emphasizing that Bhismadeva's body was spiritualized through devotional service.

segments.key_quote: jayanti is exclusively reserved for the supreme lord and his pure devotees not for other people who are spiritually ignorant though they may be materially very very accomplished
segments.summary: The lecture distinguishes between honoring spiritually advanced souls and the misuse of 'Jayanti' ceremonies for ordinary people, reserving it for the Lord and His pure devotees.

segments.key_quote: bhishma deva was unique in his activities and his passing away to the kingdom of god is also unique so this is uh the way bhishma deva passed away nirvikalpa samadhi
segments.summary: The speaker describes Bhismadeva's passing in Krishna consciousness as ideal and emphasizes that the Lord's appearance is for the sake of showing mercy to conditioned souls.

segments.key_quote: everyone can achieve this perfection that bhishma deva achieved of going back to godhead simply by practicing devotional service to godhead
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by emphasizing that everyone can achieve perfection like Bhismadeva through devotional service, especially hearing and chanting, and highlights the importance of the Bhagavad Gita and Srimad Bhagavatam.
